item.title: How a Flawed Team Responsibility Structure Destroyed a Mars Mission
item.description: In 1999, NASAâ€™s Mars Climate Orbiter was minutes from entering orbit around the Red Planet. Instead, it flew too close to the atmosphere and burned up, vanishing without a trace.

item.title: Building Software Teams That Thrive: It's About People, Not Process
item.description: For decades, the software industry has been obsessed with finding the perfect process. We’ve treated development like a production line, breaking it into discrete steps handled by different specialists.
